name: Avoid using NSPredicate predicateWithFormat
description:
An attacker could access other user information thanks to string injection. Manipulating input, an attacker could fetch more data from the database than what was originally intended by the application.
The injection could be done in NSPredicate using the methods
predicateWithFormat:,
predicateWithFormat:arguments:,
predicateWithFormat:argumentArray:
The injection point will be part of the format string as @"...%@...". 
This rule is compliant with CISQ OMG ASCSM-CWE-134 and ASCSM-CWE-89 recommendations and with OWASP 2016-M7 recommendation
output:
Line and column for each violation 
Associated value => number of violations found
rationale: An attacker could access other user information thanks to string injection through the withFormat method. This is why it is highly recommended to avoid the usage of the API
alternativeName: Ensure not using string uncontrolled string concatenation to build NSPredicate request

qualityStandards.name: Injection flaws, particularly SQL injection. Also consider OS Command Injection, LDAP and XPath injection flaws as well as other injection flaws.
The application must protect from command injection.
